basic_info.name: Vidhant Jain
basic_info.headline: Product Manager | AI Enthusiast | Building Next-Gen Solutions
basic_info.about: Passionate about building products that solve real problems. Currently focused on AI/ML applications in product development. Love exploring new technologies and sharing learnings with the community.

experience.title: Product Manager
experience.description: Leading AI product development and strategy

real_comments: Love this. The part about timing hit different. We learned that the hard way too.
That's exactly what we saw. Cash flow beats everything else when reality hits.
Been there. The pivot saved us but man, those 3 months were brutal.
This. The authenticity piece is what most people miss early on.
Yep. Learned this after our first failed launch. Now it's rule #1.
Great point about user research. Spent 6 months building the wrong thing once.
The AI integration part is interesting. How'd you handle the compute costs?
This resonates. Took us 2 years to figure out our actual value prop.
Timing > idea. Painful lesson but the most important one.
Cash flow doesn't care about your roadmap. Hard truth.
